name: Aston at Poipu Kai

reviews.text: We had a great time despite a few hassles. Different units at Poipu Kai are managed by different companies. The best area is Poipu Sands. Units with ocean views (peeks), have closer water views than in the other parts of Poipu Kai and one of the two out of a total of 7 swimming pools that are reasonably sized and accessible only to renters with an appropriate key. Other 6 pools on the property range from foot spas to almost swimmable. Ocean can be rough in winter. Management company for the units moved us in 3 days because they had booking problems. Polite but annoying. We had to firmly request a unit in Poipu Sands that had access to the pool, and a decent view (tho we had confirmed reservations months in advance).
reviews.title: Kauai the Best No Matter What
nice area
reviews.text: I stayed at the resort from January 25 to Feb 8, 2006 with 3 other friends. We were out of our condo early morning everyday, came back and it had been cleaned by the staff. I told them the floor needed to be washed, orange sand ruined my slippers, left them there. construction is going on across the road from our condo, about 100 yards, would not recommend staying in that particular area, noisy machines early morning however, everything closes down at 10.p.m in poipu. If you want a quiet, just beach bar holiday, then go but if you want lots of fun then choose other places. Be sure to go on the Air Kauai helicopter tour, it is worth every penny. Touring the island and shopping are about the only things interesting outside of the beauty of the island and the beaches.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at this resort for 10 days, as we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Great stay
Scary
reviews.text: We had a great stay, awesome views,and beautiful sunrises every morning. The staff is great, we did have a problem with a leaky pipe in the wall, (thru no fault of anyone, things happen) they just moved us to another condo, which was even more stunning. (Thank you Eric)
The area we were in (Poipu Sands) was relatively quiet which we enjoyed a lot.
reviews.title: Fabulouse family location, close to everything and clean

likes.liked: — Extreamly close to the beach, pool, gear rental and food.
likes.disliked: — That not all of the units where as nice as ours. Our friends had a unit that was less attractive and out of date.

reviews.text: The grounds were kept beautiful, the flowers are stunning.
reviews.title: Wonderful week at the Poipu Kai

likes.liked: — It was spacious, comfortable, and well located.
likes.disliked: — Not ocean front and bathrooms could use updating.

reviews.text: We took advantage of the grills to cook on and eat on our lanai many evenings. We were close to Poipu beach, we saw monk seals and turtles there. the snorkeling was great.
reviews.title: Cockroaches at Resort Quest Poipu Kai

likes.liked: — Location was great and the house was very spacious

reviews.title: Hit or Miss
reviews.text: I like to think of myself as pretty fair and I give credit where credit is due, but I can not recommend this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of condos are all individually owned and it shows. Some units may be nice and others are in need of dire update. I went with family and we all stayed in 3 separate units and the difference in each unit was startling. I've stayed in Motel 6's that are in better condition and have better amenities as well. While my parents had a nice plasma TV, my wife and I had a an old 26 inch CRT TV. Not to mention our refrigerator was rusting, doors were chipped, and the unit smelled of mildew.
reviews.title: Poor quality unit

reviews.text: Expect to clean the unit when you leave. There are extensive rules in terms of taking out your garbage, cleaning dishes, etc. Unfortunately for my sister, whomever stayed in the unit before her didn't wash the dishes well as she found dried corn and other food.
reviews.title: Snug, clean oceanfront condo with lots of storage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kauai is beautiful and I would definitely go back to the Poi Pu area but next time I will stay at the Hyatt, after it was all said and done the two are comparable and I don't have to wash my own towels and dishes while on MY vacation.
reviews.title: Not quite what I remember...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Althought the complex (Poipu Sands) was great and in a great location, our unit was unbelievably bad. It hadn't been updated in at least 10 years. The living room furniture was worn and fraying. The floors and the bathroom were horrible (rusty sink, poorly patched tile), and the bed extremely uncomfortable. The dryer was so dirty that I had to spend an hour cleaning out the gross black stuff from all over the dryer before we could use it. But the worst was the lanai furniture. It looked like it came out of a dumpster. I think they could have gotten better furniture from along the road. It was so nasty and uncomfortable that we couldn't even enjoy the great view. So if you do decide to book with ResortQuest at Poipu Kai, be sure to avoid unit 427 in Poipu Sands.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed this beautiful resort

likes.liked: — The beautiful setting, and having a condo as opposed to just a room.
likes.disliked: — Having to leave at the end of the trip!

reviews.title: Pleased with condo, despite some reviews.

likes.liked: — Internet Access, Beautifully Kept Grounds, Friendly Staff
likes.disliked: — Some units not as clean as others, Proximity of Beach and Restaurants

reviews.text: My 12 year old daughter and I arrived in Kauai on 3/28/08. I had booked our stay through Expedia. About a week before we arrived, I read the scary "cockroach" review here. I got nervous, so I called Expedia to see what my options were if we wanted to check out early. They called RQ Poipu Kai, and were told that we would need to either pay a 2 night penalty or check out after 2 nights. Expedia advised that they kept the reservation for 7 nights, but that I should call them if we were not satisfied.
reviews.title: Loved the resort!

likes.liked: — The plasma screen tv in the living area and the atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got there and checked in, the front desk showed that we were checking out after 2 nights. I explained that we weren't sure what our plans would be (until I made sure there were no cockroaches!), but that we were not planning on checking out early. "No problem", he said. "We will just change it to 7 nights." So he gave us the keys to condo #504 (garden view) in the Manualoha section of the resort. My daughter loved it. I was surprised at how big it was, especially for just the 2 of us. There is a master bedroom on the main floor. And twin beds in an upper loft. She was thrilled that not only would she have her own room (with a TV), but it also had a small deck that overlooked the grounds. It was pretty cute. It has a nice sized kitchen and living room. There are sliding glass doors that open to a lanai.
reviews.title: Resort Quest Poipu - a wonderful experience

reviews.text: It was perfectly fine for the price, and for what we needed it to be: A place to cook breakfast and occasional dinner, and a place to put our heads at the end of a busy day at the beach!
reviews.title: We liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, it could have definitely used a good spring cleaning. The walls felt sort of sticky, and the glass on the pictures on the walls was coated with dust. The remote controls to the TV's had food drips on them. And the showers could have used a thorough cleaning.
reviews.title: Mixed review

description: Nestled on 70 acres of Kauai's sunny south coast, this condominium resort delights guests with ocean views, tropical gardens, private pools and tennis courts. Golf, dining and shopping are all nearby. This prime location is adjacent to Brennecke's Beach, Shipwreck Beach and the "Spouting Horn" blowhole.
